CountryData.name: French Guiana
CountryData.description: French Guiana, an overseas territory of France, is a land of dramatic contrasts – a dense, largely untouched rainforest meeting the Atlantic Ocean. Characterized by its unique biodiversity, challenging terrain, and a strong Amerindian presence, it’s a destination for adventurous travelers and researchers alike. The territory boasts a significant portion of the Guiana Shield, a geological formation rich in mineral resources and ancient landscapes.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Spanning a vast area, French Guiana is the fourth-largest French overseas territory.
quickFacts.detail: It’s roughly the size of Belgium.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population is a diverse mix of French, Creole, and indigenous peoples.
quickFacts.detail: Creole is the most widely spoken language.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Cayenne is a port city and the administrative center of French Guiana.
quickFacts.detail: It’s located on the island of Matapï.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: As part of France, French Guiana uses the Euro.
quickFacts.detail: However, French Guiana has its own postal codes and identification documents.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language, but Creole is widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Dutch was historically spoken by settlers.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: The economy is heavily reliant on natural resources and space activities.

climateData.title: Tropical Rainforest Climate
climateData.description: French Guiana experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, with distinct wet and dry seasons, though the wet season is generally prolonged.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This season is dominated by heavy rainfall, often accompanied by thunderstorms and flooding. Rivers swell, and travel can be challenging.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings slightly lower rainfall and more sunshine. Temperatures remain consistently warm, but humidity decreases somewhat.

naturalWonders.name: Kai Island
naturalWonders.description: Kai Island, located off the coast of French Guiana, is a pristine wilderness area renowned for its exceptional biodiversity and dramatic coastal scenery. It’s a vital nesting site for sea turtles and home to a variety of endemic bird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island is largely uninhabited and accessible only by boat. Its rugged coastline and dense rainforest create a truly remote and captivating landscape.  The island’s unique geological history has contributed to its remarkable flora and fauna.

naturalWonders.name: Apatou Falls
naturalWonders.description: Apatou Falls is the highest waterfall in French Guiana, cascading down a sheer cliff face into a refreshing pool below. It’s a popular destination for swimming and enjoying the natural beauty of the rainforest.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The falls are located within a protected area and are surrounded by lush vegetation. The surrounding area offers opportunities for hiking and wildlife viewing. The water is cool and clear, providing a welcome respite from the tropical heat.

ecosystemData.title: Guiana Shield Rainforest Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: French Guiana is dominated by the Guiana Shield rainforest, one of the world’s largest and most biodiverse rainforests. This ancient geological formation is characterized by towering trees, dense undergrowth, and a remarkable array of plant and animal life.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of the territory is protected in national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: French Guiana is home to a variety of mammals, including jaguars, tapirs, capybaras, and various monkey species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: The rainforest is a haven for birdlife, with numerous endemic and migratory species.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in French Guiana
activities.description: French Guiana offers a wide range of outdoor activities for adventurous travelers, from hiking and wildlife viewing to river cruises and exploring the rainforest.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the rainforest on foot and discover hidden waterfalls and scenic viewpoints.

activities.name: Kai Island Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the rainforest to Kai Island, offering stunning coastal views and wildlife encounters.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, insect repellent, water bottle
safety: Be aware of snakes and insects

activities.name: Apatou Falls Hike
activities.description: A short hike to the base of the impressive Apatou Falls.

activityCategories.name: River Cruises
activityCategories.description: Experience the rainforest from a unique perspective on a river cruise.

activities.name: Esquibo River Cruise
activities.description: A multi-day cruise along the Essequibo River, offering opportunities to spot wildlife and visit indigenous communities.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, long pants

equipment.basic: Backpack, water bottle, flashlight, first-aid kit
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass

safety: Carry a satellite phone or personal locator beacon (PLB)
